intro: Leandra cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf leandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces showy, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. Leandra cinerea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
